intro: Davejonesia lichenastra, commonly known as the golden lichen, is a unique plant characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green coloration. It belongs to the family Lichenes, which is a group of symbiotic organisms composed of fungi and algae or cyanobacteria. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its structure consists of a thallus, which is a composite body formed by the mutualistic relationship between the fungal and algal components. Davejonesia lichenastra plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
